title: Abbreviations
data:
Writing about NetHack can be cumbersome where item names are concerned. A system of **abbreviations** has arisen to make this quicker:

- Instead of writing "blessed" or "cursed", write "b" or "c"
- Instead of writing the type of an item, use its symbol: "?!+=/
- Instead of writing "of", write "o"
- Instead of writing the name of an item, use its first letters

Some common examples:

- c!oGL

  [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level")

- b!oFH

  [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") [potion of full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing")

- "oLS

  [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving")

- +oCM

  [spellbook of create monster](/wiki/Spellbook_of_create_monster "Spellbook of create monster")

- +oMM

  - [spellbook of magic missile](/wiki/Spellbook_of_magic_missile "Spellbook of magic missile")
  - (or [spellbook of magic mapping](/wiki/Spellbook_of_magic_mapping "Spellbook of magic mapping"))

- \=oSD

  [ring of slow digestion](/wiki/Ring_of_slow_digestion "Ring of slow digestion")

- /oD

  [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death")

- /oW

  [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing")

This scheme is ambiguous for several items, so it's common to extend the fourth rule in cases such as:

- ?oTele, ?oTel

  [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation")

- !oHallu

  [potion of hallucination](/wiki/Potion_of_hallucination "Potion of hallucination")

Other popular items have developed abbreviations and acronyms of their own:

- GDSM

  [gray dragon scale mail](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scale_mail "Gray dragon scale mail")

- SDSM

  [silver dragon scale mail](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scale_mail "Silver dragon scale mail")

- \*DSM

  any dragon scale mail

- GoP

  [gauntlets of power](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_power "Gauntlets of power")

- GoD

  [gauntlets of dexterity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_dexterity "Gauntlets of dexterity")

- HoOA

  [helm of opposite alignment](/wiki/Helm_of_opposite_alignment "Helm of opposite alignment")

- CoMR

  [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance")

- BoH

  [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding")

- unihorn

  [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")

- FoD

  [finger of death](/wiki/Finger_of_death "Finger of death") spell

- SoA

  [The Staff of Aesculapius](/wiki/The_Staff_of_Aesculapius "The Staff of Aesculapius")

- AoY

  [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor")

- MB

  [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane")

- MKoT

  [The Master Key of Thievery](/wiki/The_Master_Key_of_Thievery "The Master Key of Thievery")

- MMoM

  [The Magic Mirror of Merlin](/wiki/The_Magic_Mirror_of_Merlin "The Magic Mirror of Merlin")

## Nicknames

A few items are popular or notorious enough to have acquired a nickname:

- Mojo

  [Mjollnir](/wiki/Mjollnir "Mjollnir")

- Vorpy

  [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade")

- Frosty

  [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand")

- Stormy

  [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer")

- The Staff of Misspelling, The Staff of Asparagus

  [The Staff of Aesculapius](/wiki/The_Staff_of_Aesculapius "The Staff of Aesculapius")

- The Eye, The Eye of Tapioca, EotA

  [The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica")

- The Orb of Weight

  [The Orb of Fate](/wiki/The_Orb_of_Fate "The Orb of Fate")

- The finger

  the [finger of death](/wiki/Finger_of_death "Finger of death") spell

- The Eyes

  [The Eyes of the Overworld](/wiki/The_Eyes_of_the_Overworld "The Eyes of the Overworld") (not to be confused with "the Eye")
html:
Abbreviations

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Writing about NetHack can be cumbersome where item names are concerned. A system of abbreviations has arisen to make this quicker:

  • Instead of writing "blessed" or "cursed", write "b" or "c"
  • Instead of writing the type of an item, use its symbol: "?!+=/
  • Instead of writing "of", write "o"
  • Instead of writing the name of an item, use its first letters

Some common examples:

c!oGL
cursed potion of gain level
b!oFH
blessed potion of full healing
"oLS
amulet of life saving
+oCM
spellbook of create monster
+oMM
spellbook of magic missile
(or spellbook of magic mapping)
=oSD
ring of slow digestion
/oD
wand of death
/oW
wand of wishing

This scheme is ambiguous for several items, so it's common to extend the fourth rule in cases such as:

?oTele, ?oTel
scroll of teleportation
!oHallu
potion of hallucination

Other popular items have developed abbreviations and acronyms of their own:

GDSM
gray dragon scale mail
SDSM
silver dragon scale mail
*DSM
any dragon scale mail
GoP
gauntlets of power
GoD
gauntlets of dexterity
HoOA
helm of opposite alignment
CoMR
cloak of magic resistance
BoH
bag of holding
unihorn
unicorn horn
FoD
finger of death spell
SoA
The Staff of Aesculapius
AoY
Amulet of Yendor
MB
Magicbane
MKoT
The Master Key of Thievery
MMoM
The Magic Mirror of Merlin

Nicknames

A few items are popular or notorious enough to have acquired a nickname:

Mojo
Mjollnir
Vorpy
Vorpal Blade
Frosty
Frost Brand
Stormy
Stormbringer
The Staff of Misspelling, The Staff of Asparagus
The Staff of Aesculapius
The Eye, The Eye of Tapioca, EotA
The Eye of the Aethiopica
The Orb of Weight
The Orb of Fate
The finger
the finger of death spell
The Eyes
The Eyes of the Overworld (not to be confused with "the Eye")

Writing about NetHack can be cumbersome where item names are concerned. A system of '''abbreviations''' has arisen to make this quicker:

* Instead of writing "blessed" or "cursed", write "b" or "c"
* Instead of writing the type of an item, use its symbol: "?!+=/
* Instead of writing "of", write "o"
* Instead of writing the name of an item, use its first letters

Some common examples:

; c!oGL 
: [[cursed]] [[potion of gain level]]
; b!oFH 
: [[blessed]] [[potion of full healing]]
; "oLS 
: [[amulet of life saving]]
; +oCM 
: [[spellbook of create monster]]
; +oMM 
: [[spellbook of magic missile]]
: (or [[spellbook of magic mapping]])
; =oSD 
: [[ring of slow digestion]]
; /oD 
: [[wand of death]]
; /oW 
: [[wand of wishing]]

This scheme is ambiguous for several items, so it's common to extend the fourth rule in cases such as:

; ?oTele, ?oTel 
: [[scroll of teleportation]]
; !oHallu 
: [[potion of hallucination]]
Other popular items have developed abbreviations and acronyms of their own:

; GDSM 
: [[gray dragon scale mail]]
; SDSM 
: [[silver dragon scale mail]]
; *DSM 
: any dragon scale mail
; GoP 
: [[gauntlets of power]]
; GoD 
: [[gauntlets of dexterity]]
; HoOA 
: [[helm of opposite alignment]]
; CoMR 
: [[cloak of magic resistance]]
; BoH 
: [[bag of holding]]
; unihorn 
: [[unicorn horn]]
; FoD
: [[finger of death]] spell
; SoA 
: [[The Staff of Aesculapius]]
; AoY
: [[Amulet of Yendor]]
; MB
: [[Magicbane]]
; MKoT
: [[The Master Key of Thievery]]
; MMoM
: [[The Magic Mirror of Merlin]]

==Nicknames==

A few items are popular or notorious enough to have acquired a nickname:

; Mojo 
: [[Mjollnir]]
; Vorpy 
: [[Vorpal Blade]]
; Frosty 
: [[Frost Brand]]
; Stormy

; The Staff of Misspelling, The Staff of Asparagus

; The finger
: the [[finger of death]] spell
; The Eyes
: [[The Eyes of the Overworld]] (not to be confused with "the Eye")
